availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin McGill (Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Foster, Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Eleanor Mullins in December 1857 in Pendleton County, Kentucky. Father of William S. McGill, Sallie B. McGill, and Charles F. McGill. Farmer in Bracken County in 1850. Farmer in Bracken County in 1860. Pendleton County resident in July 1863. Rented a room in George S. Kimberly's blacksmith shop and apartment building in Foster, Kentucky, from December 12, 1862 to February 15, 1863.
